function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased time spent at home during the pandemic may have led to differences in temperature tolerances and influenced HVAC use, impacting energy consumption and potentially increasing the risk of indoor air quality issues.","Impact":"Higher energy consumption and potential indoor air quality issues due to changes in HVAC use and temperature tolerances.","Mitigation":"Conduct indoor air quality assessments, adjust HVAC systems to accommodate new occupancy patterns, and educate occupants about maintaining indoor air quality.","Technologies":"Smart HVAC systems with air quality monitoring, ventilation control, and occupancy sensors.","People":"Households, building occupants, and residents.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, and HVAC professionals."},{"Description":"Lack of quantitative data reported on the impacts of COVID-19 on energy use of lighting and HVAC loads in individual buildings, leading to uncertainty and potential inefficiencies in energy management strategies.","Impact":"Uncertainty in energy consumption patterns and potential inefficiencies in energy management strategies due to lack of data on COVID-19 impacts.","Mitigation":"Conduct detailed energy audits, collect and analyze data on energy use before and during the pandemic, and develop adaptive energy management strategies based on data-driven insights.","Technologies":"Energy monitoring systems, data analytics platforms, and energy management software.","People":"Energy managers, building operators, and energy analysts.","Owner":"Building owners, energy management companies, and research institutions."},{"Description":"Limited ability for households using setback features to benefit from reduced heating and cooling energy use during unoccupied periods due to increased occupancy during the pandemic, potentially leading to higher energy consumption and reduced cost savings.","Impact":"Limited energy savings and reduced cost benefits for households using setback features due to increased occupancy during the pandemic.","Mitigation":"Implement smart occupancy sensors, optimize setback schedules based on occupancy patterns, and educate occupants about efficient HVAC use.","Technologies":"Smart setback thermostats, occupancy detection systems, and energy management platforms.","People":"Households, building occupants, and residents.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, and energy efficiency consultants."}]}
